text: What does it mean to be a fair game? When creating a simulation, what things must you consider?

A game is fair if the outcomes are equally likely to occur. When choosing a tool to simulate a game it must be able to simulate the indicated outcomes. For example, to have a random chance for two equally likely outcomes, you could use a coin, a spinner with two equal sections, two cards with different numbers, a bag with the same number of two different colors of blocks, or an odd-even on a number cube.
